title: The Marquee Element
description: Create scrolling text with the classic (deprecated but fun!) marquee element

lessons.title: Scrolling Text
lessons.description:
The <marquee> element creates scrolling text - a classic from the early web! While deprecated, it still works in most browsers.

Note: For production, use CSS animations instead. But for learning and fun, marquee is great!
lessons.task:
Create a simple marquee:
1. Add a <marquee> element
2. Put some text inside like 'Welcome to my website!'
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui; padding: 20px; background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0f0c29 0%, #302b63 50%, #24243e 100%); min-height: 150px; display: flex; align-items: center; } marquee { font-size: 2rem; color: #00ff00; text-shadow: 0 0 10px #00ff00, 0 0 20px #00ff00; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace; }

lessons.title: Direction & Behavior
lessons.description:
Control the marquee with attributes:
• direction: left, right, up, down
• behavior: scroll (default), slide (stops at edge), alternate (bounces)
• scrollamount: speed (default is 6)
lessons.task:
Create a bouncing marquee:
1. Add a <marquee> element
2. Set behavior="alternate" to make it bounce
3. Add some fun text
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui; padding: 20px; background: linear-gradient(135deg, #ff6b6b 0%, #feca57 100%); min-height: 150px; display: flex; align-items: center; } marquee { font-size: 2.5rem; color: white; text-shadow: 2px 2px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); font-weight: bold; }

validations.message: Add behavior="alternate" to make it bounce

lessons.title: Retro News Ticker
lessons.description:
Combine multiple marquee attributes for a classic news ticker effect. You can even put multiple elements inside!

Remember: This is deprecated HTML. Modern sites use CSS animations, but marquee is great for understanding web history.
lessons.task:
Create a news ticker:
1. A <marquee> with direction="left"
2. Set scrollamount="5" for smooth scrolling
3. Add a breaking news headline inside
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui; padding: 0; margin: 0; background: #1a1a2e; } marquee { background: linear-gradient(90deg, #c0392b 0%, #e74c3c 50%, #c0392b 100%); padding: 15px 0; font-size: 1.3rem; color: white; font-weight: 500; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 1px; border-top: 3px solid #f1c40f; border-bottom: 3px solid #f1c40f; }
lessons.solution: <marquee direction="left" scrollamount="5">BREAKING NEWS: Marquee element still works in browsers!</marquee>
